title: Get an organization

parameters.description:
Setting to application/vnd.github.v3+json is recommended

See preview notice.
parameters.name: accept

parameters.description: Billing email address. This address is not publicized.
parameters.name: billing_email

parameters.description: Toggles whether an organization can use organization projects.
parameters.name: has_organization_projects

parameters.description: Toggles whether repositories that belong to the organization can use repository projects.
parameters.name: has_repository_projects

parameters.description:
Default permission level members have for organization repositories:
* read - can pull, but not push to or administer this repository.
* write - can pull and push, but not administer this repository.
* admin - can pull, push, and administer this repository.
* none - no permissions granted by default.

Default: read
parameters.name: default_repository_permission

parameters.description:
Toggles the ability of non-admin organization members to create repositories. Can be one of:
* true - all organization members can create repositories.
* false - only organization owners can create repositories.
Default: true
Note: A parameter can override this parameter. See members_allowed_repository_creation_type in this table for details. Note: A parameter can override this parameter. See members_allowed_repository_creation_type in this table for details.

Default: true
parameters.name: members_can_create_repositories

parameters.description:
Toggles whether organization members can create internal repositories, which are visible to all enterprise members. You can only allow members to create internal repositories if your organization is associated with an enterprise account using GitHub Enterprise Cloud or GitHub Enterprise Server 2.20+. Can be one of:
* true - all organization members can create internal repositories.
* false - only organization owners can create internal repositories.
Default: true. For more information, see "Restricting repository creation in your organization".
parameters.name: members_can_create_internal_repositories

parameters.description:
Toggles whether organization members can create private repositories, which are visible to organization members with permission. Can be one of:
* true - all organization members can create private repositories.
* false - only organization owners can create private repositories.
Default: true. For more information, see "Restricting repository creation in your organization".
parameters.name: members_can_create_private_repositories

parameters.description:
Toggles whether organization members can create public repositories, which are visible to anyone. Can be one of:
* true - all organization members can create public repositories.
* false - only organization owners can create public repositories.
Default: true. For more information, see "Restricting repository creation in your organization".
parameters.name: members_can_create_public_repositories

parameters.description:
Specifies which types of repositories non-admin organization members can create. Can be one of:
* all - all organization members can create public and private repositories.
* private - members can create private repositories. This option is only available to repositories that are part of an organization on GitHub Enterprise Cloud.
* none - only admin members can create repositories.
Note: This parameter is deprecated and will be removed in the future. Its return value ignores internal repositories. Using this parameter overrides values set in members_can_create_repositories. See this note for details.
parameters.name: members_allowed_repository_creation_type

responses.content:
{
  "login": "github",
  "id": 1,
  "node_id": "MDEyOk9yZ2FuaXphdGlvbjE=",
  "url": "https://api.github.com/orgs/github",

title: List pending organization invitations

parameters.description: Required unless you provide email. GitHub user ID for the person you are inviting.
parameters.name: invitee_id

parameters.description: Required unless you provide invitee_id. Email address of the person you are inviting, which can be an existing GitHub user.
parameters.name: email

parameters.description:
Specify role for new member. Can be one of:
* admin - Organization owners with full administrative rights to the organization and complete access to all repositories and teams.
* direct_member - Non-owner organization members with ability to see other members and join teams by invitation.
* billing_manager - Non-owner organization members with ability to manage the billing settings of your organization.

Default: direct_member
parameters.name: role

parameters.description: Specify IDs for the teams you want to invite new members to.
parameters.name: team_ids

title: Create an organization invitation

parameters.description: Page number of the results to fetch.
parameters.name: page

title: List organization invitation teams

parameters.description:
Filter members returned in the list. Can be one of:
* 2fa_disabled - Members without two-factor authentication enabled. Available for organization owners.
* all - All members the authenticated user can see.
parameters.name: filter

parameters.description:
Filter members returned by their role. Can be one of:
* all - All members of the organization, regardless of role.
* admin - Organization owners.
* member - Non-owner organization members.
parameters.name: role

parameters.description: Page number of the results to fetch.
parameters.name: page

title: List organization members
Check organization membership for a user
Remove an organization member
Get organization membership for a user

parameters.description:
The role to give the user in the organization. Can be one of:
* admin - The user will become an owner of the organization.
* member - The user will become a non-owner member of the organization.

Default: member
parameters.name: role

parameters.name: state

title: List organization webhooks

parameterProperties.description: Required. The URL to which the payloads will be delivered.
parameterProperties.name: url

parameterProperties.description: The media type used to serialize the payloads. Supported values include json and form. The default is form.
parameterProperties.name: content_type

parameterProperties.description: If provided, the secret will be used as the key to generate the HMAC hex digest value in the X-Hub-Signature header.
parameterProperties.name: secret

parameterProperties.description: Determines whether the SSL certificate of the host for url will be verified when delivering payloads. Supported values include 0 (verification is performed) and 1 (verification is not performed). The default is 0. We strongly recommend not setting this to 1 as you are subject to man-in-the-middle and other attacks.
parameterProperties.name: insecure_ssl

parameters.description: Required. Key/value pairs to provide settings for this webhook. These are defined below.
parameters.name: config

parameters.description:
Determines what events the hook is triggered for.

Default: push
parameters.name: events

parameters.description:
Determines if notifications are sent when the webhook is triggered. Set to true to send notifications.

Default: true
parameters.name: active
